Okavango post-doc studies (still continuing).

By Thomas Gumbricht Google scholar Researchgate Scopus Linkedin Orcid

1999 I got a post-doc scholarship from the Royal Academy of Sciences in Sweden, allowing me to move to South Africa and start a post-doc at University of the Witwatersrand (Wits) in Johannesburg. My studies focused on the Okavango swamps in Botswana, but also other regional wetlands. I stayed at Wits for two years, and also worked for a few months with the tourist industry in the Okavango.

I have since then used my data and knowledge about the Okavango in many other studies, including my efforts in mapping and monitoring global tropical wetlands and peatlands.

Journal articles

  • Wolski, P. et al., Journal of Hydrology, 331(1–2), 58–72 2006. Modelling of the flooding in the Okavango Delta, Botswana, using a hybrid reservoir-GIS model.
  • Bauer, P., Gumbricht, T., & Kinzelbach, W., Water Resources Research, 42(4), 1–15 2006. A regional coupled surface water/groundwater model of the Okavango Delta, Botswana
  • McCarthy, J., Gumbricht, T., & McCarthy, T. S., Int J Remote Sensing, 26(19), 4339–4357 2005. Ecoregion classification in the Okavango Delta, Botswana from multitemporal remote sensing.
  • Gumbricht, T., McCarthy, T. S., & Bauer, P., Earth Surface Processes and Landforms, 30(1), 27–39 2005. The micro-topography of the wetlands of the Okavango Delta, Botswana.
  • Gumbricht, T. et al., J of Hydrology, 290(3–4), 178–191 2004. Forecasting the spatial extent of the annual flood in the Okavango delta, Botswana.
  • McCarthy, T. et al., Water SA, 30(1), 121–128 2004. Wastewater disposal at safari lodges in the Okavango Delta, Botswana.
  • Gumbricht, T., McCarthy, J., & McCarthy, T., Earth Surface Processes and Landforms, 29(1), 15–29 2004. Channels, wetlands and islands in the Okavango Delta, Botswana, and their relation to hydrological and sedimentological processes.
  • Andersson, L. et al., Physics and Chemistry of the Earth, Parts A/B/C, 28(20–27), 1165–1172 2003. Water flow dynamics in the Okavango River Basin and Delta – a prerequisite for the ecosystems of the Delta.
  • Gumbricht, T., & McCarthy, T., South African Geographical J, 85(2), 164–169 2003. Spatial patterns of islands and salt crusts in the Okavango Delta, Botswana.
  • McCarthy, J. et al., AMBIO: A Journal of the Human Environment, 32(7) 2003. Flooding Patterns of the Okavango Wetland in Botswana between 1972 and 2000.
  • Gumbricht, T. et al., South African J of Science, 98(7 & 8), 351–358 2002. Remote sensing to detect sub-surface peat fires and peat fire scars in the Okavango Delta, Botswana.
  • Gumbricht, T. et al., South African J of Geology, 104(3), 243–264 2001. The topography of the Okavango Delta, Botswana, and its tectonic and sedimentological implications.

Refereed chapters

  • Gumbricht, T., Multitemporal Remote Sensing (pp. 233–253) 2016. Soil Moisture Dynamics Estimated from MODIS Time Series Images.
  • Gumbricht, T., Advances in Wetland Classification and Mapping (pp. 435–454) 2015. Hybrid Mapping of pantropical wetlands from optical satellite images, hydrology and geomorphology.
  • Bauer, P., Gumbricht, T., & Kinzelbach, W., Hydrology in Mediterranean and semiarid regions (Vol. 60, pp. 130–137) 2003. Hydrological modelling and resource management in the Okavango Delta.
  • McCarthy, T. et al., Sedimentation in Continental Rifts (pp. 179–193), Special Publications of SEPM 2001. The Okavango Delta – semiarid alluvial-fan sedimentation related to incipient rifting.

Conference Proceedings

  • Bauer, P. et al., 17th Salt Water Intrusion Meeting (pp. 309–321) 2002. Is density flow balancing the salt budget of the Okavango delta? Evidence from field and modelling studies.
  • Wolski, P. Gumbrocht, T., & McCarthy, T., Environmental Monitoring of Tropical and Subtropical Wetlands (pp. 4-8) 2002. Assessing future change in the Okavango Delta: the use of a regression model of the maximum annual flood in a Monte Carlo simulation.
  • Bauer, P. Gumbricht, T., & Kinzelbach, W., Environmental Monitoring of Tropical and Subtropical Wetlands 2002. A spatially distributed hydrological model for the Okavango Delta.
  • Gumbricht, T., & McCarthy, T., Environmental Monitoring of Tropical and Subtropical Wetlands (pp. 181–195) 2002. Hierarchical Processes and Patterns Sustaining the Okavango: An Integrated Perspective for Policy and Management.
  • Gumbricht, T., Mccarthy, J., & Mccarthy, T., 12th International Symposium on Remote Sensing of the Environment (CD publication) 2000. Portraying the geophysiology of the Okavango Delta, Botswana.
